item.title: FAQs on all conspiracy theories about Trump assassination attempt
Israel-Gaza war live: Unrwa HQ ‘turned into a battlefield’ in heavy fighting, says agency chief
item.description:
Philippe Lazzarini says facility has been ‘flattened’ in incident that shows ‘blatant disregard of international humanitarian law’

  • See all our Israel-Gaza war coverage

After a night spent shaking in fear as the roof rattled from explosions, and a long walk along a crowded road, Diana Mahmoud arrived at the hospital where she gave birth to her son, Yaman.

Mahmoud, 22, discovered she was pregnant a week after the outbreak of the war in Gaza and, like other mothers who became pregnant about that time, spent her entire pregnancy fearing for her own safety as well as that of her child. Miscarriages are three times more likely than before the war, according to a February report by the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine and the Johns Hopkins Center for Humanitarian Health.

Continue reading...

item.title: Focus on Bethel Park as classmates describe suspected Trump gunman
item.description:
Classmates say 20-year-old was smart and shy, with no particular interest in politics or history of violence

  • US politics live – latest updates

In Bethel Park, where the man who is suspected of opening fire at a Donald Trump campaign rally on Saturday lived with his mother and sister, the houses are small and built of brick, Walmart and Target form central social hubs, and moms watch over their children at a junior league baseball park next to a tributary of the Allegheny River.

The attempted assassination of the Republican former president just 45 miles north has put a focus on Bethel Park, as investigators attempt to establish the motivations of the 20-year-old shooter.

Continue reading...
